The Estee Lauder Companies, the prestige cosmetics maker that is preparing to sell shares to the public, said yesterday that it had established a strategic alliance with Bobbi Brown Professional Cosmetics Inc., a line of makeup-artist cosmetics.
Makeup-artist cosmetics, which feature a wide range of colors packaged in inexpensive containers, are the hottest segment of the high-end color cosmetics market.

While Bobbi Brown will retain control of its North American operations and product development worldwide, Lauder plans to build the brand internationally, using its vast and powerful global distribution network.

Terms of the deal were not disclosed, though they are likely to be incorporated in the prospectus related to Lauder's initial public offering -- expected later this year. Industry analysts said Bobbi Brown had been seeking a buyer to finance its growth for some time.
Lauder, which owns the Clinique, Prescriptives and Aramis lines as well as its flagship brand, has a similar arrangement with Bobbi Brown's biggest rival, M.A.C.
